Major_Arcs.title: Ghost Town and Saloon Intrigue
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces the setting in a ghost town saloon and establishes initial character interactions and underlying tensions.

sub_scenes.title: Saloon Scene Setting and Initial Dialogue
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene sets the atmosphere of the saloon and introduces initial character interactions, focusing on a blonde woman's explanation to an off-panel man and the reaction from onlookers.

narrative_arcs.title: Saloon Scene Setting
The Blonde Woman's Explanation
Conversation Continues - Man's Response and Old Timers' Wisdom

Major_Arcs.title: Ghost Town's Impending Demise and Cowboy's Lament
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts focus to the external threat to the Ghost Town, with the arrival of modern surveyors and their plans for demolition, contrasted with the nostalgic reflections of a cowboy.

sub_scenes.title: Nostalgia vs. Modernity
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene contrasts the cowboy's nostalgic farewell to the Ghost Town with the arrival of surveyors planning to demolish it for an airport, highlighting the conflict between past and future.

narrative_arcs.title: Cowboy's Farewell and Nostalgic Reflection
Modern Arrival and Ghost Town Observation
Airport Plan and Town Demolition Imminent
Emotional Reaction to Ghost Town's Destruction

Major_Arcs.title: Nan and Cal's Relationship Turmoil
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc centers on the turbulent relationship between Nan and Cal, marked by accusations, reflections, and emotional distance.

sub_scenes.title: Accusations and Internal Conflict
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene explores the immediate conflict between Nan and Cal through accusations and defenses, alongside Nan's internal reflections on their past relationship.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Accusation and Cal's Defense
Woman's Reflection on Past Relationship with Cal
Ghost Town Demolition and Woman's Outburst

Major_Arcs.title: Business and Family Conflicts
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on business discussions related to cattle and the airport, leading to a father-daughter conflict and Nan seeking reassurance about her relationship.

sub_scenes.title: Business Discussions and Father-Daughter Disagreement
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts business conversations concerning cattle shipping and the airport, culminating in a conflict between Nan and her father over horses for construction.

narrative_arcs.title: Cattle Shipping and Airport Business Discussion
Horses for Construction and Father-Daughter Conflict

sub_scenes.title: Seeking Reassurance and Resolve
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene covers Nan's seeking reassurance about Cal's love from her family, her internal doubts, and her decision to confront Cal directly.

narrative_arcs.title: Reassurance of Cal's Love
Nan's Resolve to Seek Clarity

Major_Arcs.title: Pursuit, Interruption, and Business Commitment
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts Nan's attempt to chase Cal for clarity, interrupted by business obligations from her father, leading her to prioritize business over personal matters.

sub_scenes.title: Interrupted Pursuit and Business Task
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Nan chasing Cal, only to be redirected by her father with an urgent business task, forcing her to shift her focus from personal to professional duties.

narrative_arcs.title: Chasing Cal
Horse Business Interruption
Business Deal and Commitment

Major_Arcs.title: Conversation, Departure, and Longing
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc covers the heated conversation between Nan and Cal, his subsequent departure, Nan's reaction, and the time skip showing her longing for him.

sub_scenes.title: Departure and Emotional Aftermath
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the intense conversation leading to Cal's departure, Nan's immediate reaction, and a time skip showing her prolonged longing and emotional distress.

narrative_arcs.title: Intense Conversation and Impending Departure
Cal's Departure
Reaction to Departing Horses
Time Skip and Nan's Longing Narration
Cal's Return and Confession of Love

Major_Arcs.title: Reunion, Weather Crisis, and Romantic Hope
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc covers Cal's return and confession of love, juxtaposed with the onset of a severe snowstorm and the subsequent crisis it brings, ultimately leading to a hopeful resolution.

sub_scenes.title: Snowy Reunion and Impending Weather Crisis
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene begins with Nan and Cal's snowy reunion and unease, quickly shifting to the introduction of a severe weather crisis and its immediate impact on livestock.

narrative_arcs.title: Reunion and Unease in the Snow
Arrival at the Snowy Homestead and Weather Report
Concern Over Livestock and Fodder Shortage
Assessing the Snow's Severity and Nan's Concern
Narrative Description of Relentless Snowfall
Cal's Decisive Action to Save the Cattle

sub_scenes.title: Fodder from the Sky and Romantic Reassurance
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the shift from despair to hope with the arrival of a plane carrying fodder, leading to a romantic reassurance between Nan and Cal amidst the relief.

narrative_arcs.title: Indoor Despair and a Glimmer of Hope
Plane Arrives with Fodder
Hope and Romantic Reassurance

Major_Arcs.title: Cowtown Justice and Jeff's Gun Fascination
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces a new setting in Cowtown and focuses on Chane Benson's showdown, public reactions, and Jeff's concerning fascination with guns and violence.

sub_scenes.title: Showdown and Public Commentary in Cowtown
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Chane Benson's showdown in Cowtown and the varied public reactions and moral judgments of his character.

narrative_arcs.title: Showdown and Reactions in Cowtown
Debate on Chane Benson's Character
Dismissive Reaction and Age Critique

sub_scenes.title: Jeff's Gun Obsession and Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on Sally's concern about Jeff's gun obsession, leading to a confrontation and the revelation of Jeff's admiration for Clyde Surratt and his violent tendencies.

narrative_arcs.title: Reminiscing About Jeff's Childhood
Gun Obsession Critique
Confrontation over Gun Cleaning
Lectures and Disobedience
Plea for Decency
Clyde Surratt Admiration
Boasting and Challenge to Clyde Surratt
Violent Threat and Laughter

Major_Arcs.title: Intervention for Jeff and Article Controversy
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Sally and Pete's plan to help Jeff, the introduction of Mr. Benson, and the controversy surrounding Clyde's article about Benson.

sub_scenes.title: Planning to Guide Jeff and Benson's Demeanor
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene covers Sally and Pete's plan to help Jeff, reaffirming their love, and introduces Mr. Benson with a narrative reflection on his unsettling demeanor.

narrative_arcs.title: Planning to Help Jeff
Reaffirming Love and Duty Towards Jeff
Introduction of Mr. Benson and Sarcastic Remark
Narrative Reflection on Shane Benson's Demeanor

sub_scenes.title: Article's Fallout and Benson's Response
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene explores the fallout from Clyde's article about Benson, Sally's fear for Clyde, and Benson's confrontational response and justification for staying in town.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation about the Article
Sally's Fear and Clyde's Reassurance
Benson's Confrontation and Justification for Staying
Benson Justifies His Stance and Criticizes Clyde
Sally and Surrett Discuss Clyde's Article and Benson's Impact
Considering Inviting Chane Benson for Dinner
Discussing Chane's Skills and Dinner Invitation

Major_Arcs.title: Dinner Invitation, Jealousy, and Violence
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc follows the dinner invitation to Chane Benson, leading to Jeff's jealous confrontation, escalating violence, and Sally's strong reaction.

sub_scenes.title: Moonlight Walk and Jealous Assault
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the polite interaction between Sally and Chane during a moonlight walk, abruptly interrupted by Jeff's jealous confrontation and assault on Sally.

narrative_arcs.title: Polite Conversation and Departure for Moonlight Walk
Jeff's Jealous Confrontation
Escalating Aggression and Unwanted Kiss
Sally's Angry Retort and Accusations

sub_scenes.title: Retaliation, Pursuit, and Newspaper Office Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene covers the aftermath of the assault, Chane's retaliation against Jeff, Sally's urgent plea to save Clyde, and the confrontation inside the newspaper office.

narrative_arcs.title: Post-Kiss Conversation and Jeff's Justification
Chane's Retaliation and Threat, Sally's Urgent Plea
Desperate Ride to Save Clyde
Confrontation Inside the Newspaper Office
Benson's Challenge and Chane's Departure with Clyde
Anxious Wait and Sally's Regret
Headline Change Order
Newspaper Partnership and Sally's Pride

Major_Arcs.title: Betsy and Steve's Ranch Dynamics and Romance
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Betsy and Steve's relationship, ranch troubles, and their developing romance amidst external threats.

sub_scenes.title: New Boss Introduction and Initial Unease
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Steve Daley as the new boss on the ranch, Betsy's initial unease about him, and discussions about ranch troubles and suspicions.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation and Gender Insult
Introduction of Steve Daley as the Boss
Discussion of Trouble with the New Boss
Initial Interaction and Betsy's Unease with Steve
Ranch Troubles and Suspicions of Double K
Trip to Town and Hank's Orders for Betsy

sub_scenes.title: Town Confrontation and Romantic Confession
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Betsy's confrontation in town, a bar fight scene, Betsy's realization about Steve, and culminates in Betsy's confession of love to Steve.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation with Fred Bridges at the Store
Bar Fight and Aftermath
Betsy's Realization about Steve and Ranch Decision
Betsy's Change of Heart and Hank's Suggestion
Betsy's Confession to Steve
Negotiating Terms and Gunfighter Identity
Love Confession and a Difficult Request
The Ultimate Proof of Love and a Kiss

Major_Arcs.title: Devil's Pass and Near-Death Experience
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts the escalating conflict leading to Devil's Pass, Steve's near-fatal shooting, and the subsequent romantic reunion and resolution.

sub_scenes.title: Ranch Confrontation and Ride to Devil's Pass
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene covers the escalating tensions at the ranch, Betsy's firm stance, Steve's reflections on violence, and their ride to Devil's Pass.

narrative_arcs.title: Accusations and Demands at the Ranch
Escalating Threats and Betsy's Firm Stance
Reflection on Violence and Foreshadowing of Attack
Betsy's Plea and Hank's Determination
Desperate Plea and Steve's Resolve
Betsy's Contemplation and Impending Action
Ride to Devil's Pass and Ceasefire

sub_scenes.title: Devil's Pass Confrontation and Romantic Reunion
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the confrontation at Devil's Pass, Steve's shooting, Betsy's emotional reaction and reunion with Steve, culminating in a romantic declaration.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival at Devil's Pass and Initial Confrontation
Capture, Debate, and Shooting of Steve
Betsy's Faint and Reunion with Steve
Relief and Reflection on Survival
Romantic Declaration and Future Together

Major_Arcs.title: Carrie, Dave, and Fred - Love, Business, and Reconciliation
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on the love triangle between Carrie, Dave, and Fred, intertwined with business conflicts and ultimately leading to a reconciliation and a marriage proposal.

sub_scenes.title: Dave's Sulking and Flashback to Fence Dispute
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene begins with Dave's sulking and transitions into a flashback explaining the fence dispute and the ranchers' confrontation with Fred Gordon.

narrative_arcs.title: Dave's Sulking and Rebuke
Flashback to Curley's Arrival at the Corral
News of Fencing and Range Trouble
Ranchers Discuss the New Fence
Confrontation at the Fence Line
Planning to Secure the Herd
Escalating Tension with Fred Gordon
Curley Intervenes to Prevent Violence
Disarming and Expulsion of Fred Gordon and Brother
Aftermath and Assertion of Ranch Ownership

sub_scenes.title: Love Confession and Brotherly Reconciliation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on the emotional complexities between Carrie, Dave, and Fred, including Carrie's confession of feelings for Fred, brotherly reconciliation, and culminates in Fred's marriage proposal.

narrative_arcs.title: Reluctant Friendship and Brotherly Disdain
Defense of Fred's Actions and Implicit Feelings
Confession of Conflicted Feelings
Seeking Honesty and Deeper Conversation
Affirmation of the Current Relationship
Internal Monologue of Perceived Unspoken Love
Sudden Interruption and Confrontational Inquiry
Accusation and Defensive Stance
Attempt to De-escalate and Initial Refusal
Accusation of Heartbreak and Questioning Conclusions
Declaration of Possessiveness and Protectiveness
Confession of Love Trigger and Reassurance
Brotherly Reconciliation and Movie Invitation
Flashback of Budding Romance and Anticipation
Marriage Proposal and Acceptance

sub_scenes.title: Business Deal Misunderstanding and Emotional Resolution
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene explores the misunderstanding about the Carlton contract and its impact on Carrie's relationship with Dave, leading to emotional confrontations and a final reconciliation.

narrative_arcs.title: Concern and Misinterpretation Regarding Dave's Feelings
Clarification of Misunderstanding and Business Motives
Revelation of Selfishness and Business Priority
Angry Accusation of Deception and Trickery
Desperate Plea and Rejection of Affection
Internal Reflection on Suspicion and Motivation
Confrontation and Inquiry about Intentions
Anticipation and Impatience Before Confrontation
Direct Confrontation with Mr. Carlton
Accusation of Trickery and Business Betrayal
Defiant Assertion of Independence and Self-Reliance
Emotional Aftermath and Reflection of Foolishness
Reconciliation and Comfort in Affection
Relief and Lingering Pain After Decision
Distant Reunion in Town After Weeks Apart
Inquiry and Confirmation of Love
Riding Back and Discussing Past and Present Feelings

sub_scenes.title: Carrie's Illness, Fred's Return, and Final Reconciliation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Carrie's illness, Fred's brother's search for her, father-daughter conflict over the beef contract, Carrie and Fred's final reconciliation, and their engagement.

narrative_arcs.title: Concern and Arrival of Visitors
Father's Scolding about Beef Contract
Confrontation and Unhappiness Regarding a Promise
Reflection, Embrace, and Reconciliation

Major_Arcs.title: Dirk and Rance's Brotherhood and Final Confrontation
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on the complex relationship between Dirk and Rance, Dirk's escape and injury, Rance's pursuit, and their final confrontation at the wedding.

sub_scenes.title: Dirk's Escape and Pursuit Begins
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Dirk's bedroom interruption, his injury discovery, and the start of his escape as Marshal Rance Cready arrives at the ranch.

narrative_arcs.title: Bedroom Interruption and Urgent Summons
Discovery of Gunshot Wound and Reassurance
Discussion about Dirk's Fight and Empty Gun
Marshal Rance Cready's Arrival and Ranch Confrontation

sub_scenes.title: Marshal's Pursuit and Shooting at Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene covers the concern for Dirk's injury, the debate between the Marshal and Chris about duty and justice, and the ensuing pursuit and violent confrontation.

narrative_arcs.title: Concern for Injured Man and Introduction of Dirk's Situation
Debate on Duty, Justice, and Decision to Stay for Dirk
Romantic Reconciliation after Argument
Urgent Plea to Rescue Dirk
Contemplating Rescue Strategy and Legal Implications
Escape and Pursuit Begins
Failed Evasion and Pursuit Persistence
Confrontation, Shooting, and Aid
Disagreement on Fate of the Marshal
Departure and Difficult Decision
Confession of Love and Understanding
Rance's Defiance and Acceptance of Escape

sub_scenes.title: Rance's Recovery, Romantic Proposal, and Wedding Interruption
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Rance's recovery, his father's relief, the doctor's visit, Chris's confession and proposal, and Dirk's dramatic wedding day interruption and capture.

narrative_arcs.title: Rance's Awakening and Father's Relief
Doctor's Inquiry and Father's Explanation
Confession and Proposal
Mary and Chris's Confessions and Fears
Wedding Day is Here, but Dirk is Missing
Dirk Interrupts the Wedding and Confrontation
Marshal's Plan, Dirk's Capture and Backstory Revealed
